definitions.definition: to recognize or show that two things are not the same
definitions.sensetop: differentiate (between) A and Bdifferentiate A (from B)

examples.text: It's difficult to differentiate between the two varieties.
I can't differentiate one variety from another.
Birds are able to differentiate colours.
She can just differentiate between light and dark.
Teachers should differentiate clearly between different kinds of correction.

definitions.definition: to be the particular thing that shows that things or people are not the same

examples.text: The male's yellow beak differentiates it from the female.
features which clearly differentiate this product from other similar ones

definitions.definition: to treat people or things in a different way, especially in an unfair way

examples.text: Rules that differentiate between employees on the basis of gender need to be revised.

definitions.definition: to become more specialized during growth and development; to make a cell or tissue more specialized during growth and development

examples.text: The fertilized egg differentiates into several different cell types.
The receptors are developed and differentiated into sense organs.

wordOrigin: early 19th cent.: from medieval Latin differentiat- ‘carried away from’, from the verb differentiare, from differentia from different- ‘carrying away’, from the verb differre, from dis- ‘from, away’ + ferre ‘bring, carry’.
